channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Flutterwave buys Nigeria’s Mono in rare African fintech exit
item.description: Africa’s largest fintech company, Flutterwave, has acquired Nigerian open banking startup Mono in an all-stock deal valued between $25 million and $40...

item.title: Kodiak taps Bosch to scale its self-driving truck tech
item.description: There is no timeline for when these systems will become available. But once they do, Kodiak could bring its tech to more trucks, faster.

item.title: Plaud launches a new AI pin and a desktop meeting notetaker
item.description: Plaud is going after the likes of Granola to launch a desktop app that records online meetings

item.title: French and Malaysian authorities are investigating Grok for generating sexualized deepfakes
item.description: France and Malaysia have joined India in condemning Grok for creating sexualized deepfakes of women and minors.

item.title: Subtle releases ear buds with its noise cancelation models
item.description: Subtle's new $199 earbuds will also let you dictate in any app on desktop or phone

item.title: Trump Wants Venezuela's Oil. Getting It Might Not Be So Simple
item.description: The administration has made it clear that Nicolás Maduro's capture was tied to Venezuela's vast oil reserves. Much less certain is how US companies wi...

item.title: 15 Best Electrolyte Powders (2026): Tasty and Effective
item.description: Get those lost minerals back with the help of our top picks.

item.title: Can a social app fix the ‘terrible devastation’ of social media?
item.description: Twitter co-founder Biz Stone and Pinterest co-founder Evan Sharp have raised new funding for a social media app that helps users "plan with intention....

item.title: French and Malaysian authorities are investigating Grok for generating sexualized deepfakes
item.description: France and Malaysia have joined India in condemning Grok for creating sexualized deepfakes of women and minors.

item.title: DoorDash says it banned driver who seemingly faked a delivery using AI
item.description: DoorDash seems to have confirmed a viral story about a driver using an AI-generated photo to lie about making a delivery.
